p: Yields and Chemical Constituents of O. gratissimum Oil. The yield of O. gratissimum leaf essential oil was 3.54 g/kg fresh weight. Chemical identification of essential oil was accomplished by GC-MS analyses. Table 2 shows the constituents of the essential oil, their percentage area, and their retention time (min). A total of 16 compounds representing 100 % of the O. gratissimum oil were identified. The major constituents of this oil were eugenol (67.38 %) and Z- β-ocimene (14.95 %). The percentage compositions of remaining 14 compounds ranged from 0.09 to 5.25 %. The major constituents of this essential oil from leaves of O. gratissimum L. reported in this present study were similar to those previously established by Bunrathep et al., 2007 (Pathumthani, Thailand) [ 32], Matasyoh et al., 2007 (Meru, Kenya) [ 33], and Malebo et al., 2013 (Dar es Salaam, Tanzania) [ 13]. In contrast, the essential oil from O. gratissimum harvested in Turkey, Cameroon, and Brazil was found to be particularly rich in thymol and γ-terpinene [ 34– 36].
